discussion_comments.comment_body:
... una conexión de red limitada. 

Or instead of "limitada" it can be "medida" 
These are more common accepted terms.

discussion_comments.comment_body: Doesn't "Red" primarily mean for general network settings? This toggle is specific to cellular, and the one below on line 107 would be for Wi-Fi.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -84,27 +84,27 @@
     </message>
     <message>
         <source>Prevent large data uploads when on a metered cellular connection</source>
-        <translation type="unfinished"></translation>
+        <translation>Evite cargas de grandes cantidades de datos cuando utilice una conexión celular con medidor</translation>
discussion_comments.comment_body:
After putting a bit more though It could create confusion for some other countries. 

"...conexión celular medida" would be the most universal way to say it.

First I thought "Coupler" but I saw that "Associer" is the verb used in all other instances ("coupler" never appears). I wanted the new translations to be consistent with the text. What do you think? should we change those other instances to "Coupler"? Or another verb? Also maybe we should put this one in all caps, and imperative form right... Let me change that.
